perturbation.original_text: The MHC, in accordance with the plan of conversion as adopted by the Boards of Directors of each of the Blue Hills Parties (the "Plan"), intends to convert from the current mutual holding company form of organization to a stock holding company form of organization (the "Conversion"). Pursuant to the Plan, the Holding Company will offer and sell up to 24,150,000 shares (subject to increase up to 27,772,500 shares) of its common stock, $0.01 par value per share (the "Shares"), in a subscription offering (the "Subscription Offering") to (1) depositors of the Bank with Qualifying Deposits (as defined in the Plan) as of February 28, 2013 ("Eligible Account Holders"), (2) the Bank's tax­ qualified employee benefit plans, including the employee stock ownership plan established by the Bank (the "ESOP"), and (3) employees, officers, directors, trustees and corporators of the Bank, the Mid-Tier and the MHC who do not have a higher priority to purchase stock. Subject to the prior subscription rights of the above­listed parties, the Holding Company may offer for sale in a direct community offering (the "Community Offering" and when referred to together with or subsequent to the Subscription Offering, the "Subscription and Community Offering") the Shares not subscribed for or ordered in the Subscription Offering to members of the general public to whom a copy of the Prospectus (as hereinafter defined) is delivered with a preference given first to natural persons and trusts of natural persons residing in the local community as defined in the Plan, and thereafter to cover orders of other members of the general public. It is anticipated that Shares not subscribed for in the Subscription and Community Offering may be offered to certain members of the general public on a best efforts basis through a selected dealers agreement (the "Syndicated Community Offering") or to certain members of the general public in a firm commitment underwritten offering (the "Underwritten Offering") with the Agent acting as sole book­running manager (the Underwritten Offering, Subscription Offering, Community Offering and Syndicated Community Offering are collectively referred to as the "Offering").
perturbation.changed_text: The MHC, in accordance with the plan of conversion as adopted by the Boards of Directors of each of the Blue Hills Parties (the "Plan"), intends to convert from the current mutual holding company form of organization to a stock holding company form of organization (the "Conversion"). Pursuant to the Plan, the Holding Company will offer and sell up to 24,150,000 shares (subject to increase up to 27,772,500 shares) of its common stock, $0.01 par value per share (the "Shares"), in a subscription offering (the "Subscription Offering") to (1) depositors of the Bank with Qualifying Deposits (as defined in the Plan) as of February 28, 2013 ("Eligible Account Holders"), (2) the Bank's tax­ qualified employee benefit plans, including the employee stock ownership plan established by the Bank (the "ESOP"), and (3) employees, officers, directors, trustees and corporators of the Bank, the Mid-Tier and the MHC who do not have a higher priority to purchase stock. Subject to the prior subscription rights of the above­listed parties, the Holding Company may offer for sale in a direct community offering (the "Community Offering" and when referred to together with or subsequent to the Subscription Offering, the "Subscription and Community Offering") the Shares not subscribed for or ordered in the Subscription Offering to anyone with a copy of the Prospectus (as hereinafter defined). It is anticipated that Shares not subscribed for in the Subscription and Community Offering may be offered to anyone in a firm commitment underwritten offering (the "Underwritten Offering") with the Agent acting as sole book­running manager (the Underwritten Offering, Subscription Offering, Community Offering and Syndicated Community Offering are collectively referred to as the "Offering").
perturbation.explanation: By removing the preference for local residents in the Community Offering, and removing the best effort basis for the Syndicated Community Offering, the contract now contradicts the intent of community preference often mandated in bank conversions. This deviation from standard practice introduces uncertainty regarding regulatory compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 167H and Chapter 33, Subpart D of the Code of Massachusetts Regulations

perturbation.original_text: Conversion Agent Services. The Agent shall also receive a fee of $50,000 for certain conversion agent services set forth in the letter agreement, dated October 7, 2013, among the MHC, the Mid-Tier, the Bank and the Agent (a copy of which is attached hereto as Exhibit B), $10,000 of which has already been paid to the Agent and is nonrefundable and the balance of which shall be payable to the Agent upon completion of the Offering. The Holding Company will reimburse the Agent, upon request made from time to time, for its reasonable out-of-pocket expenses incurred in connection with its conversion agent services not to exceed $25,000 without the consent of the Blue Hills Parties. However, in the event of unusual circumstances, delays or a re-solicitation in connection with the offering, the total fees paid to the Agent may be increased by an additional amount not to exceed $10,000.
perturbation.changed_text: Conversion Agent Services. The Agent shall also receive a fee of $50,000 for certain conversion agent services set forth in the letter agreement, dated October 7, 2013, among the MHC, the Mid-Tier, the Bank and the Agent (a copy of which is attached hereto as Exhibit B), $10,000 of which has already been paid to the Agent and is nonrefundable and the balance of which shall be payable to the Agent as the agent see fits. The Holding Company will reimburse the Agent, upon request made from time to time, for expenses incurred in connection with its conversion agent services. However, in the event of unusual circumstances or delays or a re-solicitation in connection with the offering, the total fees paid to the Agent may be increased by an additional amount.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the constraints regarding the balance amount and the additional reimbursement amount to Agent. This change introduces a conflict with standard requirements for clear and limited compensation in financial agreements.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Reserve Board regulations governing bank holding company formations

perturbation.original_text: The Blue Hills Parties carry, or are covered by, insurance in such amounts and covering such risks as is adequate for the conduct of their respective businesses and the value of their respective properties as is customary for companies engaged in a similar industry.
perturbation.changed_text: The Blue Hills Parties may carry insurance covering such risks and amounts deemed necessary by the bank.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces misaligned terminology by removing the standard of 'customary for companies engaged in a similar industry' and replacing it with a subjective assessment by the bank. This conflicts with standard insurance practices and introduces potential risks.
perturbation.contradicted_law: FDIC regulations regarding adequate insurance coverage for financial institutions
